# Open Construction Source List for CFB Petawawa

**Reference:** OR22SLPA

**Publication Date:** December 12, 2022

**Tender Closing Date:** March 31, 2026, 14:00:00 EST

**Background**

The Department of National Defence's Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites contractors and suppliers to apply to be placed on the Open Construction Source List (OCSL) for CFB Petawawa and its satellite site in Pembroke. The OCSL will be used to tender construction services, including commercial, residential, industrial, institutional, and civil work, with an estimated value of $10 million or below.

**Eligibility and Selection Criteria**

Contractors and suppliers interested in being placed on the OCSL must submit a request through the MERX posting, indicating their preferred official language (English or French). The language selected will be the only language used for all future tenders and during the execution of any resulting contract. Faxed, mailed, or emailed submissions will not be accepted.

**Contracting Requirements**

Contracts awarded by DCC include measurable performance standards and requirements. Contractors may be removed from the OCSL if their performance is deemed unacceptable. All contracts are subject to DCC's Procurement Code of Conduct and may contain organization and personnel security requirements. Contractors must hold the required security clearance(s) at the time of tender closing.

**Benefits and Opportunities**

Placing contractors and suppliers on the OCSL provides them with opportunities to bid on construction services for DCC. Quarterly Advance Procurement Notices (APN) may be published to inform interested contractors of potential tenders with anticipated security requirements.

**Application and Contact Information**

To apply, interested contractors and suppliers should submit a request through the MERX posting. For more information, contact Jacob Lachapelle at Jacob.Lachapelle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or visit the Defence Construction Canada website at https://www.dcc-cdc.gc.ca/industry.

**Language Policy**

The official language of the OCSL will be determined by the applicant's preferred language (English or French). All communications and tender documents will be in the selected language.

**Trade Agreements**

The OCSL may be used for procurements covered by trade agreements to which Canada is a party, including the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).
